alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 4:07PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Sequatchie, eastern Marion and Hamilton Counties through 545 PM EST/445 PM CST/... At 507 PM EST/407 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Dunlap to 7 miles southeast of Jasper. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Dunlap, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Walden, Lakesite, Whitwell, Ridgeside, Fairmount and Harrison. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
